comment: The transposition swaps the arguments in a two-argument function. When ` F ` is a matrix, which is to say a function from ` ( 1 ... m ) X. ( 1 ... n ) ` to ` RR ` or some ring, ` tpos F ` is the transposition of ` F ` , which is where the name comes from. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2015.)
